IonicSecurity::SDK::Crypto Class Reference

Exposes static methods to initialize and shutdown the entire crypto module. More...

Static Public Member Functions

static void Initialize ()
 Initialize the crypto library. More...
 
static void Shutdown ()
 Shutdown the crypto library. More...
 

Detailed Description

Exposes static methods to initialize and shutdown the entire crypto module.

Member Function Documentation

◆ Initialize()

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Crypto::Initialize ( )
static

Initialize the crypto library.

This function must be called before any function from any part of the cryptography library may be called. Applications typically call this function during startup before doing any work.

An SdkException is thrown in the event of an error.

◆ Shutdown()

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Crypto::Shutdown ( )
static

Shutdown the crypto library.

This function should be called before the application terminates or when the crypto library is no longer needed. This gives the crypto library a chance to release any resources that were allocated by initialization or during operation.

An SdkException is thrown in the event of an error.
